locutie.beschrijving: The preacher recounts the trial of Jesus before Herod and the encounter with the weeping women of Jerusalem on the road to Calvary.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-narrative reconstruction; harmonizes multiple Gospel accounts and adds historical context regarding the Herodian dynasty.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts historical facts and moral truths, with a late shift toward warning (Directives) and a plea for God's presence (Expressive).
voorbeelden: I refer to the appearance of our arrested Savior before Herod.
This was the silence of contempt.
I plead for your earnest attention.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To evoke solemnity, fear of God's silence, and a sense of total commitment beyond mere emotion.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher asks God not to be silent in his soul, implying the Spirit's work in communication.

voorbeelden: Herod was the son of that other Herod.
This was not the silence of resignation.
Do not force the Lord into silence.
Live so that you can say, 'Speak, Lord'.
I plead for your earnest attention.
I do not want to do anything to make him silent in my soul.
Be sure the Lord Christ will not [forget].
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak; the preacher rarely speaks on behalf of God to bind God to the hearer.

voorbeelden: The word of this sermon is really twofold.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low; the preacher describes the event rather than enacting the event of grace.

indicatoren: Extensive historical detailing of the six trials.
Lengthy descriptions of Herod's family tree.
Talking 'about' the silence of Jesus rather than mediating the Word.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a historical drama rather than a participant in a current encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct promise of grace to the individual
Sacramental declaration of 'Today this word is fulfilled'.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information overload leading to moralistic pressure at the end.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's own feelings and homiletical signposting ('I refer to').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly in the final application and warnings about God's silence.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used for Directives (commands) rather than Commissives (promises).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Historical narrative about Jesus, Herod, and the women.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'grand pageant' feel that keeps the hearer at a distance.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Dominates the retelling of the Passion narrative.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about history and God's reversals.

actueel_present.gebruik: Limited to the very end of the sermon.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (History of Herod/Trials) -> Directive (Don't let God be silent/Give your life).
voorbeelden: He first appeared before Annas... [to] ...Do not force the Lord into silence.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'ought' (Directive) is not grounded in a 'given' (Commissive/Promise) for the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: God demands more. My life! My all! ... Do not force the Lord into silence.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a historical lecture with a moralistic appeal at the end. It describes the 'event' of the Passion without becoming an 'event' of grace for the listener.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The blood-spattered head presented by a sensuous young woman.

zwakke_punten.probleem: No promise of what Christ's silence achieves for the hearer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a talk 'about' a past event, not a 'happening' of the Word in the present.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the declarative authority to convey the benefits of Christ to the hearer.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the story, but rarely the speaker of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a witness/historian than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I deal with that most difficult of undertakings for a preacher.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Minimal; only implied in the plea for God not to be silent.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as a reminder of grace, not a means of grace.
tekstueel_bewijs: We are following our Lord on the road to Calvary.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is buried in past-tense assertives. It needs a shift to present-tense commissives and declaratives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: He was the Savior of the world as he bore his cross toward the hill upon which he died for you and me.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, Christ carries that cross for you; here and now, He cancels your debt.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a historical fact to a present reality (Declarative).

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The sermon ends with 'God demands more' (Directive) without 'God gives all' (Commissive).
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Insert a promise that Christ's silence before Herod was the silence that justifies the sinner.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He was silent before Herod, He speaks a word of peace to you today.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' in the context of the Gospel promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: He stands before you now, not as a trickster for your curiosity, but as your Savior.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'Give your life' is too heavy because the indicative 'His life is yours' is missing.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the call to service in the finished work of Christ.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and historically rich, but it risks leaving the hearer as a spectator. By turning your historical assertions into present-tense promises, you will move from 'talking about' the Passion to 'enacting' the Passion.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (his fear of God's silence); SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Word to change the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to move the emotions (Perlocution); SAT seeks to perform a spiritual transaction (Illocution).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's 'Constative Surplus' actually prevents the 'Event' by keeping the Word in the third person.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High for narrative, low for encounter.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Preaching as History' rather than 'Preaching as Sacrament'.
